initialize.title: Initialize Auto-iFlow
initialize.description: This project doesn't have Auto-iFlow initialized. Would you like to set it up now?
initialize.createFolder: Create a .auto-iflow folder in your project
initialize.setupSpecs: Set up the specs directory for your tasks
initialize.sourcePathNotConfiguredDescription: Please set the Auto-iFlow source path in App Settings before initializing.
initialize.initFailedDescription: Failed to initialize Auto-iFlow. Please try again.

gitSetup.title: Git Repository Required
gitSetup.description: Auto-iFlow uses git to safely build features in isolated workspaces
gitSetup.notGitRepo: This folder is not a git repository
gitSetup.needsInit: Git needs to be initialized before Auto-iFlow can manage your code.
gitSetup.needsCommit: At least one commit is required for Auto-iFlow to create worktrees.
gitSetup.willSetup: We'll set up git for you:
gitSetup.createCommit: Create an initial commit with your current files
gitSetup.initializingRepo: Initializing git repository and creating initial commit...
gitSetup.readyToUse: Your project is now ready to use with Auto-iFlow!

githubSetup.connectDescription: Auto-iFlow requires GitHub to manage your code branches and keep tasks up to date.
githubSetup.claudeDescription: Auto-iFlow uses iFlow for intelligent features like Roadmap generation, Task automation, and Ideation.
githubSetup.repoDescription: Auto-iFlow will use this repository for managing task branches and keeping your code up to date.
githubSetup.branchDescription: Choose which branch Auto-iFlow should use as the base for creating task branches.
githubSetup.branchExplanation: Auto-iFlow creates isolated workspaces for each task. Selecting the right base branch ensures your tasks start with the latest code from your main development line.
githubSetup.ready: Auto-iFlow is ready to use! You can now create tasks that will be automatically based on the {{branchName}} branch.

worktrees.title: Worktrees
worktrees.description: Manage isolated workspaces for your Auto-iFlow tasks
worktrees.emptyDescription: Worktrees are created automatically when Auto-iFlow builds features. They provide isolated workspaces for each task.
worktrees.mergeDescription: Merge changes from this worktree into the base branch.
worktrees.deleteDescription: This will permanently delete the worktree and all uncommitted changes. This action cannot be undone.

addFeature.title: Add Feature
addFeature.description: Add a new feature to your roadmap. Provide details about what you want to build and how it fits into your product strategy.
addFeature.featureTitlePlaceholder: e.g., User Authentication, Dark Mode Support
addFeature.featureDescriptionPlaceholder: Describe what this feature does and why it's valuable to users.
addFeature.rationalePlaceholder: Explain why this feature should be built and how it fits the product vision.
addFeature.failedToAdd: Failed to add feature. Please try again.

addProject.title: Add Project
addProject.description: Choose how you'd like to add a project
addProject.openExistingDescription: Browse to an existing project on your computer
addProject.createNewDescription: Start fresh with a new project folder
addProject.createNewSubtitle: Set up a new project folder
addProject.projectNameHelp: This will be the folder name. Use lowercase with hyphens.

customModel.title: Custom Model Configuration
customModel.description: Configure the model and thinking level for this chat session.

removeProject.title: Remove Project?
removeProject.description: This will remove "{{projectName}}" from the app. Your files will be preserved on disk and you can re-add the project later.

startupRestore.title: Restore previous tabs?
startupRestore.description: Choose which project tabs to reopen, or start fresh for this session.
startupRestore.note: Starting fresh keeps your saved tabs intact for the next launch.
